channel.title: Backend on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Backend on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Bloom Filter
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is Bloom Filter? A Bloom Filter is a probabilistic data structure used for testing whether an element is a member of a set or not.

item.title: Introduction to CRDT
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is CRDT? Conflict-free Replicated Data Types (CRDTs) (aka convergent replicated data type or commutative replicated data type) are data structures that can be replicated across multiple computers in a network, where the replicas can be updated independently and concurrently without coordination between them, and enable operations to always converge to a final state consistent among all replicas.

item.title: SQL Saragable Queries and Their Impact on Database Performance
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Structured Query Language (SQL) is widely used for managing data in relational database management systems (RDBMS). In the context of SQL, the optimization of database queries forms the foundation for efficient data retrieval, providing quicker response times and increasing overall database performance.

item.title: The removal of Apache Kafka's dependency on Zookeeper
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before the removal Importance of Zookeeper Kafka has been using Zookeeper for a variety of important functions. It uses Zookeeper to keep track of which brokers are part of the Kafka cluster.

item.title: SQL and how it relates to Disk Reads and Writes
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What are random and sequential reads and writes? Random and sequential reads and writes refer to the way data is accessed, read, and written on hard disks
